picket.translation[0].definitions[0].def: when a group of people stand or march in front of a shop, factory, government building etc to protest about something or to stop people from going in during a strike
picket.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There was a mass picket  (=one involving a lot of people) by students outside the main office of the university.
They organized a picket of the power station.
picket.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a person or the group of people involved in a picket
picket.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The pickets persuaded some drivers not to enter the factory.
picket.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a soldier or a group of soldiers with the special duty of guarding a military camp
picket.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to stand or march in front of a shop, factory, government building etc to protest about something or to stop people from going in during a strike
picket.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Protesters are still picketing outside the White House gates.
picket.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to place soldiers around or near a place as guards
picket.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a group of people who stand in front of a shop, factory, or other building to protest about something or to stop people from going to work during a STRIKE
picket.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: a picket on the steps of the Federal court building
Workers refused to cross a picket line to unload the fish.
picket.translation[2].definitions[1].def: one person in a picket line
picket.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The pickets persuaded some drivers not to enter the factory.
